website_summaries.verdict: Although the Panasonic Lumix DMC-LX3 has its share of passionate fans, we think the JPEG quality should be more consistent for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Classic Advance Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about the "Classic" Panasonic LX3 that others haven't said before? It has become a classic camera. It delivers great image quality for a compact camera with the ability to shoot raw files. It has a good lens with 24mm wide angle. There is even an quality add on lens with adapter that can make it 18mm ultrawide. It has great controls with good look and feel to the camera. Currently used price is lower than the newer less quality compact cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn C.

customer_reviews.title: I Almost Never Use my DSLR Any More!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the LX3 for a couple of months now. I've pretty much stopped using my big Nikon. This camera has more functionality in a small package than just about anything else I've seen. As others have stated, the fast lens is a huge plus--low-light situations that dogged my old compact digital are no problem for the LX3. I didn't have an issue with the auto white balance others have noted, but the auto-focus was a little quirky when taking sunset pics. Firmware version 1.2 took care of that little annoyance. All in all, this is a fine product--but I'd wait till the price drops! My goodness--it's going for $699 today. Supply and demand still works, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Robt C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product works as expected Compact and great image quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product works as expected Slow autofocus the plus its compact and small pic quality from leica lens excellent
customer_reviews.author: Ja

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the LX3 for a couple of weeks and so far it performs as advertised. I especially like the opportunities the wider-than-usual lens offers. Image Quality is at least as good as my other P&S cameras from Canon and Sony, but at this point I really can't say it's any better. Much better value than it's Leica relative. Good, solid feel suggests excellent construction and reliability. I'm quite happy with this camera based on initial results. I do wish there was a good, reasonably-priced auto flash available.
customer_reviews.author: The Rabbi

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: The title of this review pretty much says it all. I really like this camera and am taking my time learning its specifics - and there are alot of specifics! That is, the camera can do more than I will probably use. The images I've made so far have pleased me and the wide-angle lens is astounding. On the downside, I knew when I bought it that it didn't have a view finder and I'm having to get used to the LCD monitor. Knowing what I know now, I'd happily make the purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Tarbox

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera. It's great for low-light conditions which I was looking for in my next camera. The seller was great, they sent it fast and they unexpectedly sent me also additional lenses which are very useful if I want to take my time, be artsy and take more than just regular pictures.
customer_reviews.author: MamaNurse

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic LX-3 camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera is excellent. Best digital I've ever had. Leica licensed lens is sharp, very sharp. 24mm equivalent is the main reason why I bought it, and it does not disappoint. I was able to buy a 25mm Voigtlander finder for it, to use as a normal optical viewer, as the camera does not come with an optical finder, the one principal fault I find with the camera. The Voigtlander finder was $159 at B&H Photo, in NYC, versus the hard to source Panasonic finder at almost $300. Get the Voigtlander. Taking night photos either hand held or with a tripod is easy, and they usually come out great. Very impressive in Manhattan. Thank you, Panasonic, and Leica.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: A great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a DMC-LX5 and ordered the LX-3 for my daughter. This is a great little camera. It is like having a portable DSLR. It takes great pictures with the east of a point and shoot. It has a Leica lens and numerous settings and modes depending on how much control of the picture you want. I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Gybbster

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE what I got!!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this camera. This will be my last compact digital camera and my next camera will be a DSLR. I was confused in choosing either Canon G11 or LX3 at first but I prefer the low aperture feature that LX3 has. So I made this my Christmas present. I like its size and the crystal clear LCD screen. You might have to read up the instructions book before you really play with it because you can do many things with this amazing gadget! But if you just want to take pictures with the auto mode, you will be delighted by its performance. It takes very good, shape and clear pictures with just auto mode.
customer_reviews.author: Kitman

customer_reviews.title: The thrill of photography has returned
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a pleasure to use. Whether using manual settings or the automatic (ia) setting, the IQ is fantastic. My first Lumix was the FZ-10. It, too, produced amazing shots. Since then, I've had two other cameras in the Lumix lineup. I enjoy both of those, but they've never given me the excitement of the FZ-10. With the LX3, I've found that excitement all over again. The Leica Summicron lens give super sharp, beautifully saturated photos. In short, I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: R. Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot, evah!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 'point and shoot' camera for my wife and daughter just before leaving on vacation. Sifted through dpreview.com and found this camera to be 'Highly recommended'. If you are looking for something out of the box ready to shoot with little time or expertise this is your camera; the photos were breathtaking. This camera, unlike my other 'point and shoot' captures the image with little perceptible lag. Best of all, it has adjustable manual settings if you want to experiment. On the downside, it could use a little more zoom.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic camera purchase, "Amazing"
customer_reviews.text: This camera is truly exceptional. It takes amazing pictures and the build quality is top notch I have owned this camera for about three years and have never had a single problem. The reputation Panasonic has established for building great cameras has certainly proved itself to me.
customer_reviews.author: majic1

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Seen
customer_reviews.text: Based on price and quality, this is the best camera I've seen. The pictures are great. The settings are very flexible. The lens is low light which is great. I wouldn't trade it for anything else in a point and shoot. It's not a DSLR so I don't even try to compare it to those.
customer_reviews.author: Woodie

customer_reviews.title: Biggest bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Just a great all around camera, offering both auto and manual modes for getting more creative...great macro, clean vid mode. I bought the adapter and wide angle lens and it serves me very well for my real estate sales needs! Great wide shots with minimal barelling.
customer_reviews.author: Smart_Kilted_Man

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier. The trade off for giving up zoom is well worth it. Living in Kauai allows me to do all sorts of fun stuff, and the landscape is other-worldly and surprisingly varied. There's this one cave on the north shore that is particularly dark. Going to Aperture priority and just setting the camera on a rock allowed the most beautiful shots. Video is great. Camera is easy to use. Photo quality outstanding. I am an amateur photographer, so I'm sure there are some nits I could pick, but I'm too dumb to know what they are. I'm a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Thieu

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect camera that shoots like the big boys.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful small camera that lets you do some things that only the big DSLRs permit, like vary your f-stops and exposure times. You can, of course, shoot completely automatic if that's what to want to do, but having the flexibility to shoot manually is great. It has one major flaw: no optical viewfinder. Also, you can't zoom when shooting video, and speaking of zoom, it could be a tad longer. But the important thing is that the picture quality is outstanding. It might be a little overpriced since it is so much in demand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vetrie

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY THRILLED. GREAT  wide angle camera. I will use in combo with a high quality zoom camera also
customer_reviews.text: Don't miss that IT IS WIDE ANGLE! This is good for many close ups and action shots. A photographer needs to learn how to use this feature correctly. The build in metal and size are a gem.
customer_reviews.author: M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera at a great price. This is a versatile camera and great when in manual mode but is also easy to use as a point and shoot. Clear, crisp images.
customer_reviews.author: Dontread13

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I loved this camera. Fun point and shoot with nice features for professional photographers.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME Camera with one slight problem
customer_reviews.text: Most impressive small compact digital that have ever used. The photos are sharp and gorgeous color as well as beautiful black & white when needed. The only slight shortcoming is the built in flash. It is too hot and have yet to find a way to turn it down. Have not seen anything this good in a number of years. Why pay the extra premium for the Leica?
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh Reagan Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: LX3 review
customer_reviews.text: It's all I want in a small camera used in backpacking. My primary concern was picture quality and not zoom lens, and this camera fits the bill. Less than 10 oz. and a small footprint with attached lens cover makes it good for the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: R. Chimenti

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Live it. A bit heavy but photos great.
customer_reviews.author: Esther Ecuyer

customer_reviews.title: Eveything I Had Hoped It Would Be +
customer_reviews.text: It has a 2.o aperture, for cryin out loud!!!! Amazing!!!!! I hardly ever need to use the flash. Ever. Low light shots are great, and with some photo-editing software...perfect. The macro function is astounding. Love this camera. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Freckles

customer_reviews.title: A sweet camera
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews on this camera before buying. The reviews were right on. I have a Nikon D300 and needed a quality point and shoot. I have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: great samll camera
customer_reviews.text: As a professional photographer I am picky about image quality and camera controls. This is a great small camera with outstanding image quality. I love it for natural light photography and the wide lens is perfect for scenics and travel. If the noise level is not as good as good SLR so what... it comes very close and I can take it with me all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Warner

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic DMC-LX3 10.1MP Digital Camera with 24mm Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. He shopped around for the exact camera he wanted and the best price. He loves his new camera.
customer_reviews.author: PAR 16

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for a few years now and it takes great pictures. I would recommend it's later versions for purchase as I believe this model has been discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, for digiscoping and or for advance amateur photography
customer_reviews.text: The overall is really good. A little bit bigger than typical compact camera, but after all its has more manual setting allow you to create better pictures. The wide angle lens is amazing. Strong construction, if you buy the leather case, will have a really stylish camera. Very recomended, it is a cemera perfect for people like me who want to start take more serius the photography. Very recomended.
customer_reviews.author: Campephilus

customer_reviews.title: More I use it, the More I learn to appreciate it's quality images
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera mainly for its RAW file capabilities, I was not dissapointed. Having full control over the image data makes this a great camera. No regrets. I really love using the macro function too!
customer_reviews.author: K. Bhatti

customer_reviews.title: point & shoot high quality lens
customer_reviews.text: now outdated by Sony, but was top of the line a few years ago have taken many thousands of photographs with this little gem the current price makes it a best buy 24mm and close up ability makes for a great investigative tool
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Galli

customer_reviews.title: This is just a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I say.... This is just a great little camera. Wish I had a more powerful zoom though!
customer_reviews.author: Alic

customer_reviews.title: Happy Shopper
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur so I haven't learned how to use all of the features yet but it takes a nice picture on the automatic setting. Nice big screen yet small enough to fit in my small saddlebag or in my purse. I can finally take pictures of my horses that aren't blurred.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: LX3
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black one last year, and it was just excellent. Now I bought the silver version as a gift. Compared to the expensive Leica, Lx3 has same features and the small body is good for anyone who dislike huge SLR.
customer_reviews.author: T. Z

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera Full of Features
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great, the quality of the pictures is excellent can definitely take pictures in many situations including. Takes very crisp and realistic pictures. Only drawback is the battery life which is below par.
customer_reviews.author: Millo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th digital camera, and I like it much better than my previous point-and-shoots, as well as my SLR! I use it in manual mode with AF. I love having a camera that gives me control over aperture and shutter speed, yet is compact enough to fit in my pocket. The wide-angle, fast lens is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera. Shoots awesome, looks awesome. A little bulky and prone to collecting dirt, but over all this camera is the best Point and shoot I have ever owned... and its my 6th.
customer_reviews.author: Amerken

customer_reviews.title: the first camera i have loved since my nikon fe2
customer_reviews.text: The Lx3, for me, has finally merged the love of manual photography with the digital world. I use the 60 second exposure almost obsessively, and the macro is amazing. Anything above 400 ISO Is useless for large prints, unless you love b&w with 'film grain'.
customer_reviews.author: i9design

customer_reviews.title: The best low light point and shoot yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the best low light point and shoot available. A 24mm to 60mm F 2 Lieca lens is what makes this camera shine. Not exactly pocketable, but still easy enough to carry in a camera pouch on your belt.
customer_reviews.author: T. Finneran

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not so great with cameras and f-stops, so this little gem helps me take some great pictures. That's all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful camera and service
customer_reviews.text: Superb little jewel, with excellent results-almost as good as my Canon 20d and much more portable. Extremely quick service from J and R Music. Ordered on Wednesday, arrived on Friday. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: John B. Dozier

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Digital Camera of all time?
customer_reviews.text: At least when I bought it, this was definitely the best digital camera available. I have printed up to around 16x20 with excellent clarity. A great camera. Lots of great features.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: the best point and shoot camera!
customer_reviews.text: i didnt expect that this camera can give best pictures! it is even better with the pictures taken from my friend's dSLR.
customer_reviews.author: funshots

customer_reviews.title: Pleased Italian Customer
customer_reviews.text: This is a beatyful little digital camera with more features I will ever use in my life. Easy to use, offers yet a wide variety of settings for high quality pictures. I was a bit disappointed to discover that the camera body is made of plastic and not light metal. I believe it should come with a case to better protect the obiective which protrudes from the body. All in all I am very pleased with my new toy.
customer_reviews.author: Renzo Corvetta

customer_reviews.title: Excellent find!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It takes super sharp pictures and has taken my everyday shots to a whole new level. It makes me smile every time I get to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Of Five

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Perfect point & click for anyone, wide angle is wonderful. Added grip is nice too, not featured on the original LUMIX camera body.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: puts "point and shoot" to shame
customer_reviews.text: The options available in-camera are substantial. If you're faithful to learn them, you'll be taking some amazing pictures. The Leica lens does not disappoint. This is not a distance camera. The quality of Macro far exceeds that of anything out of portrait range. I'm using this as my primary camera, and have been satisfied, but would like to purchase an SLR in the future. Bear in mind that this camera uses a lens cap, which for some point and shoot users will seem cumbersome. If that really bothers you, I can recommend the Canon G10, just keep in mind that your macro shots will take a hit (you won't be able to shoot as close).
customer_reviews.author: K. Bullis

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular little camera
customer_reviews.text: My Lumix LX3K just arrived and I took my first pictures this afternoon. Wow! I've never shot anything quite like it before. You obviously can't compare this camera to either my Canham with Schneider lens or my Mamiya 7II, but, it does come darn close to my Nikon D200. The lens is fabulous. Again, it can't compare to my father's 1953 Leica and Leitz lenses, but, for the price, I can't imagine a better point and shoot on the market.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic LX3
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for low light (f2 lens) and landscape (24mm wide-angle lens). HD video recording. I used it for street and travel photography also. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Trung Tran

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results
customer_reviews.text: BEST CAMERA I HAVE EVER OWNED. Wish it had: time lapse video, and a more stiff mode wheel (turns sometimes just from taking it in and out of the camera bag), hand strap - only came with a neck strap, and a different lens cap design...something like the "JJC ALC3" (google it). These are very minor though, other than that its a GREAT camera for beginners like me.
customer_reviews.author: S. Luu

customer_reviews.title: its very good
customer_reviews.text: its great. would like a telephoto version. also, i can't see well enough to see if it will take lense filter. use uv filter on all my real cameras. this works like a real camera t
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great P/S camera.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera, Panasonic LX3, online without any problems. Delivery was as stated, about 5 business days. Packing could have been better as the camera box was put into the shipping container and then 'peanuts' dropped on top and sides. Note, not underneath the camera. But, this is how I have come to expect the packaging. Still, I will always deal with Amason when I can. As to the camera, it works as advertized, GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Wizzard

customer_reviews.title: nice camera
customer_reviews.text: i couldn't justify spending the money on a full frame DSLR that i wanted but wanted something more than a point and shoot. this handy little thing has turned out to be quite the find. love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rude

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little camera
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera for 2 days now and I'm amazed by it's set of manual exposure. I was deciding between the LX3 or Canon G10, but the wide lens on the LX3 really got my attention. Although this is not a DSLR, I expected less noise on high iso shots. Better than it's competitors though, including the G10
customer_reviews.author: Dija

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic digital
customer_reviews.text: Takes great pictures - just wish the downloading software gave option to choose which photos to download.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: LX3 camera
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera for landscape but NOT good on taking crystal sharp image at dark environment,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The product is as good as I knew before. and the shipping is also so fast.
customer_reviews.author: W. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Very positive transaction
customer_reviews.text: Product as advertised. Shipped quicker than estimate. Very satisfied with the camara and vendor.
customer_reviews.author: TEB

customer_reviews.title: Good camera. Worth the cost?
customer_reviews.text: Takes sharp pictures most of the time. HD video is nice. Not sure that it is worth 2X cost of other decent P&S cameras. Manual lens cap is annoying. Some buttons/switches feel flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: petey

customer_reviews.title: review on lx3
customer_reviews.text: good camera but 2.5 optical zoom is not enough. perfect for the view but for the object faraway, it's kind of hard to shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Simeng

product_meta.title: Panasonic DMC-LX3S 10.1MP Digital Camera with 2.5x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Designed for easy, creative shooting, and high-performance in low-light conditions, the Panasonic DMC-LX3 features a F2.0 24mm Leica DC Vario-Summicron lens, 10.1 megapixels and an ultra-sensitive 1/1.63-inch CCD developed specifically for this model. By combining a high-quality lens and sensor ready for a variety of shooting conditions with a wide-range of accessories and manual controls, the DMC-LX3 is ideal for professional photographers and serious amateurs looking for a compact digital camera that furthers their creative photography. 

At the heart of the DMC-LX3, is its 1/1.63-inch CCD. Making the intentional choice to limit the number of megapixels to 10.1 on its CCD, Panasonic was able to give more space for each pixel and also redesigned the peripheral circuits and other components to further minimize noise generation. As a result, sensitivity is almost 40 percent higher and saturation is increased by 35 percent when compared to Panasonic’s 10 MP digital cameras, giving the DMC-LX3 outstanding image quality and a wide dynamic range, and meeting the demand for a camera that works optimally in low-light environments. The CCD is also capable of reproducing images in three aspect ratios -- 4:3, 3:2 or 16:9. The new Multi Aspect mode allows the camera to take an image in all three aspect ratios simultaneously, allowing users to choose the version that best suits their needs. 

Another major upgrade to the LX3 is the F2.0 24mm ultra wide-angle Leica DC Vario-Summicron lens. The F2.0 is about twice as bright as a F2.8 lens and can shoot at higher shutter speeds to capture clear, blur-free images in dimly lit environments. In addition, the 24mm lens captures approximately a 213-percent larger viewing angle than a normal 35mm camera and 136% larger compared to a 28mm wide-angle lens. The lens unit consists of eight elements in six groups with four aspherical lenses with four aspherical surfaces. As a result of the F2.0 lens, the LX3 produces high resolution and minimal distortion and artifacts -- such as chromatic aberrations, ghosting and flaring. 

The LX3 also incorporates the Venus Engine IV, which provides more advanced signal processing technology for producing higher-quality images with reduced noise in both luminance signal and chromatic signal processing -- as compared to the Venus Engine III. The Venus Engine IV supports high sensitivity recording enabling the DMC-LX3 to record at up to ISO 3200 at full resolution and even up to ISO 6400 when using high sensitivity mode, enough to capture subjects in low lighting without using a flash. The Venus Engine IV also supports a faster response time, allowing the camera to shoot 2.5 shots per second at full resolution and six shots per second in High-Speed Burst mode. 

The easy-to-use joystick operation which was featured in its predecessor continues with the LX3, as its intuitive design makes selecting different settings on the camera, including focus, aperture and shutter speed -- easy and quick. Other convenient design elements include a switch on the side of the lens barrel that allows the user to quickly change the focus modes between Manual Focus, Auto Focus and Macro Auto Focus. When choosing Manual Focus, the focus distance and the depth of field according to the zoom range and aperture is also displayed. For setting white balance, the LX3 provides a new color temperature display function, and still includes the Two-Axis white balance adjustment settings offered in previous models. Users can also customize and store their own personal settings of up to four unique functions and instantly recall them later using the mode dial. 

Furthering its creative options, the LX3 also features a Film mode with six color types and three types of monochrome selections. Much like selecting from different film types, this function gives the user the flexibility and creative freedom to take more expressive digital photos. Also, when using the Multi-film mode, the LX3 produces a maximum of three images from a RAW file for the user to compare the different textures. Another new feature is the multiple-exposure feature, which lets the user create artistic photos by overlaying up to three consecutive images; while still viewing the last image on the 3.0-inch LCD screen. The LCD on the LX3 is new and improved with a 460,000-dot high resolution. 

While the LX3 allows full manual control for more advanced photography, it also includes Panasonic’s Intelligent Auto mode (iA), including the new feature, AF (auto focus) Tracking. AF Tracking automatically tracks the image subject and locks it into focus, making it easier for anyone to capture sharp, well-focused photos. The AF Tracking technology also improves face detection accuracy, allowing for crisp, sharp-focused shots even if the subject moves or turns their face. Other iA technologies include Intelligent Exposure, Digital Red-eye Correction, MEGA O.I.S, Intelligent ISO, Intelligent Scene Selector, Face Detection (up to 15 faces) and Quick AF. 

The DMC-LX3 has the ability to record High Definition (HD) video in 1280 x 720p at 24fps. With the newly added HD component output capability, still and moving pictures can be viewed by connecting the camera to a TV via an optional component cable (DMW-HDC2). In addition, the LX3 features Image Leveling, so when a captured image "leans" to the right or left because the camera was held at a slight angle when the photo was taken, this feature rotates the image to straighten it and crops the unnecessary edges.
feature_bullets: 10.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
2.5x wide-angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized zoom lens
3.0-inch high-resolution LCD screen; HD video capture
Classic SLR-like manual operations include selectable AF spot/multi AF area, customization button, aperture, shutter, program and full manual modes
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars213 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
